newsitem.title: TRINIDAD AND TOBAGO: Veteran politician, judge seek Trinidad presidency.
newsitem.headline: Veteran politician, judge seek Trinidad presidency.

text.p: A former prime minister and a high court judge will vie for the presidency of Trinidad and Tobago, the first time the post has been contested, the government announced on Tuesday.

Acting prime minister Ray Robinson and Supreme Court Judge Anthony Lucky have been nominated by the government and the opposition respectively for the post, Hector McClean, speaker of the House of Representatives, said.
The presidential selection was set for Feb. 14. The new president will succeed Noor Hassanali, 78, who is due to retire on March 19.
The president is chosen by a vote of the Electoral College, made up of members of the House of Representatives and the Senate.
